definitions: Pushed or shaken abruptly and roughly.
Moved with a sudden, jerky motion.
Caused someone or something to move or start suddenly and roughly.
Shocked or surprised (someone) in order to make them act or think in a new way.
examples: The car jolted as it hit the pothole.
The news jolted him out of his complacency.
She was jolted awake by the loud noise.
The sudden stop jolted the passengers forward.
